item.title: RTA: Unique enough to compete? - PULP
item.description:
RTA: Unique enough to compete? - PULP

In Pueblo, 'RTA' - the Regional Tourism Act, which aims to fund unique projects around Colorado that will draw a significant number of out-of-state visitors - has become synonymous with the Pueblo Convention Center expansion because of the number of tourists it is expected to draw in.

item.title: Amtrak's Southwest Chief service keeps rolling on new tracks
item.description:
Amtrak's Southwest Chief service keeps rolling on new tracks

GARDEN CITY, Kan.- Amtrak's Southwest Chief train is rumbling through the pre-dawn darkness just east of the Colorado border when a pickup truck pulls into view on U.S. Highway 50, which parallels the tracks. The truck slowly catches up to the train and then passes us, its taillights disappearing toward the Rockies.

item.description: Former Pueblo State Senator Giron said Pres. Obama's measures are "simple and responsible" gun safety. http://thepulp.me/1Jsc6vz

item.title: Will Obama's New Gun Proposals Make a Difference?
item.description:
Will Obama's New Gun Proposals Make a Difference?

Today, a visibly moved President Barack Obama proposed new rules to tighten background checks for gun buyers, regulate online firearm sales, and boost funding for enforcing gun laws. "People are dying, and the constant excuses for inaction no longer suffice," Obama said in remarks from the East Room of the White House.

item.title: Public asked help track Colorado wildlife - Aurora Sentinel
item.description:
Public asked help track Colorado wildlife - Aurora Sentinel

Wildlife officials say if someone spots a rare or protected species, like the imperiled lynx that was reintroduced into the Colorado wilderness, the finding is reported but the details are obscured on the Internet to protect the animals and allow wildlife specialists to check it out.
